```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)

colors<-c(
  "#5b94ca", #1 blue
  "#d7201d", #2 red
  "#cf8245", #3 orange
  "#92a7aa", #4 greyish blue
  "#963d8c", #5 purple
  "#40a46d", #6 green
  "#e9eb41" #, #7 yellow
  #"#2a2627"  #8 black
)

g<-ggplot()+ theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill=colors[3], colour='white'),
                   panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
                   panel.grid.minor = element_blank())

# making the circles

n<-50

my.circles<-data.frame(
  scale<-seq(1.01,.01, length=n),
  random.colors<-sample(x=colors[1:7], size=n, replace=TRUE)
  )%>%
  purrr::pmap(., 
            ~geom_polygon(
              aes(
                x=sin(seq(0, 2*pi, length=300))*..1, 
                y=cos(seq(0, 2*pi, length=300))*..1),
              fill=..2))

#add in the circles
  g<-g+my.circles


#finishing out the image 
g<-g+  coord_fixed()+
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(-1,1), expand = c(0, 0)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(-1,1), expand = c(0, 0))+
  theme(axis.title.x=element_blank(),
        axis.text.x=element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.x=element_blank(),
        axis.title.y=element_blank(),
        axis.text.y=element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y=element_blank())


png(filename="sol_lewit.png", width=550, height=550)
g
dev.off()

```
